<script>
//<![CDATA[
if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>

<script>
//<![CDATA[
if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>

<script>
//<![CDATA[
if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>

<script>
//<![CDATA[
if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>

//<![CDATA[
gl = window.gl || {};
gl.experiments = {};


//]]>
</script>

if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>

if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

</script>

  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

<script>
//<![CDATA[
if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>

<div class="issue-details issuable-details js-issue-details">
<div class="detail-page-description content-block js-detail-page-description gl-pb-0 gl-border-none">
<div><div><div class="title-container"><h1 data-qa-selector="title_content" dir="auto" class="title gl-font-size-h-display">Rethink the homepage's content</h1> <button title="Edit title and description" aria-label="Edit title and description" type="button" class="btn btn-edit js-issuable-edit btn-default btn-md gl-button btn-icon"><!----> <svg data-testid="pencil-icon" role="img" aria-hidden="true" class="gl-button-icon gl-icon s16"><use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#pencil"></use></svg>  <!----></button></div> <div><!----></div> <!----> <div class="description js-task-list-container is-task-list-enabled" updated-at=""><div data-testid="gfm-content" class="md"><p data-sourcepos="1:1-1:127" dir="auto">Right now it feels a little strange to be just dumped into the post categories with little explanation. What I'd like to do is:</p>
<ul data-sourcepos="3:1-5:183" dir="auto">
<li data-sourcepos="3:1-3:211"><svg class="drag-icon s14 gl-icon gl-cursor-grab gl-visibility-hidden" role="img" aria-hidden="true">
        <use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#drag-vertical"></use>
      </svg>Explain what "a11y" means and point to <a href="https://a11yproject.com/posts/a11y-and-other-numeronyms/" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">this article</a>. I think it's important to stress how "a11y" speaks <em>specifically</em> to web accessibility concerns.</li>
<li data-sourcepos="4:1-4:138"><svg class="drag-icon s14 gl-icon gl-cursor-grab gl-visibility-hidden" role="img" aria-hidden="true">
        <use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#drag-vertical"></use>
      </svg>Point to the checklist as a good place to get started if you don't know where to begin (and possibly revise checklist content, as well).</li>
<li data-sourcepos="5:1-5:183"><svg class="drag-icon s14 gl-icon gl-cursor-grab gl-visibility-hidden" role="img" aria-hidden="true">
        <use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#drag-vertical"></use>
      </svg>Surface other site content in the form of highlights. I'm thinking things like the latest post, featured members of the a11y community, new resources and events, that sort of thing.</li>
</ul></div> <textarea data-update-url="/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/719.json" dir="auto" data-testid="textarea" class="hidden js-task-list-field"></textarea> <!----> <!----></div> <!----></div></div>

if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>

<div class="issue-details issuable-details js-issue-details">
<div class="detail-page-description content-block js-detail-page-description gl-pb-0 gl-border-none">
<div><div><div class="title-container"><h1 data-qa-selector="title_content" dir="auto" class="title gl-font-size-h-display">Rethink the homepage's content</h1> <button title="Edit title and description" aria-label="Edit title and description" type="button" class="btn btn-edit js-issuable-edit btn-default btn-md gl-button btn-icon"><!----> <svg data-testid="pencil-icon" role="img" aria-hidden="true" class="gl-button-icon gl-icon s16"><use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#pencil"></use></svg>  <!----></button></div> <div><!----></div> <!----> <div class="description js-task-list-container is-task-list-enabled" updated-at=""><div data-testid="gfm-content" class="md"><p data-sourcepos="1:1-1:127" dir="auto">Right now it feels a little strange to be just dumped into the post categories with little explanation. What I'd like to do is:</p>
<ul data-sourcepos="3:1-5:183" dir="auto">
<li data-sourcepos="3:1-3:211"><svg class="drag-icon s14 gl-icon gl-cursor-grab gl-visibility-hidden" role="img" aria-hidden="true">
        <use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#drag-vertical"></use>
      </svg>Explain what "a11y" means and point to <a href="https://a11yproject.com/posts/a11y-and-other-numeronyms/" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">this article</a>. I think it's important to stress how "a11y" speaks <em>specifically</em> to web accessibility concerns.</li>
<li data-sourcepos="4:1-4:138"><svg class="drag-icon s14 gl-icon gl-cursor-grab gl-visibility-hidden" role="img" aria-hidden="true">
        <use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#drag-vertical"></use>
      </svg>Point to the checklist as a good place to get started if you don't know where to begin (and possibly revise checklist content, as well).</li>
<li data-sourcepos="5:1-5:183"><svg class="drag-icon s14 gl-icon gl-cursor-grab gl-visibility-hidden" role="img" aria-hidden="true">
        <use href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#drag-vertical"></use>
      </svg>Surface other site content in the form of highlights. I'm thinking things like the latest post, featured members of the a11y community, new resources and events, that sort of thing.</li>
</ul></div> <textarea data-update-url="/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/719.json" dir="auto" data-testid="textarea" class="hidden js-task-list-field"></textarea> <!----> <!----></div> <!----></div></div>

<p dir="auto" data-sourcepos="3:1-3:113">For @ericwbailey's first point, what about doing something as simple as adding an abbreviation element to the H1?</p>
<div class="gl-relative markdown-code-block js-markdown-code">
<pre data-canonical-lang="" class="code highlight js-syntax-highlight language-plaintext white" lang="plaintext" data-sourcepos="4:1-8:3" id="code-5"><code><span lang="plaintext" class="line" id="LC1"><h1 class="a11y-title"></span>
<span lang="plaintext" class="line" id="LC2">    The <abbr title="A11Y is a numeronym or shorthand for accessibility">A11Y</abbr> Project</span>
<span lang="plaintext" class="line" id="LC3"></h1></span></code></pre>
<copy-code><button type="button" class="btn btn-default btn-md gl-button btn-icon has-tooltip" data-title="Copy to clipboard" data-clipboard-target="pre#code-5"><svg><use xlink:href="/assets/icons-ce4e8ebe16c824ec266af5c86cfa08b0d35e88b4fa857e862dd87bbc726986bc.svg#copy-to-clipboard"></use></svg></button></copy-code>
</div>
<p dir="auto" data-sourcepos="10:1-10:276">I mean, it might seem a tad hypocritical, since the numeronyms primer article states that A11Y is not an abbreviation (nor an acronym) but a numeronym instead. Regardless, the <code><acronym></code> element is discontinued and I'm not aware of a <code><nuronym></code> element that would suffice :)</p>
<p dir="auto" data-sourcepos="12:1-12:208">Or, perhaps this is an opportunity to use <code><dfn></code> and <code><abbr></code> in tandem as described on <a rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dfn#Using_abbreviations_and_definitions_together" target="_blank">MDN here</a>?</p>
<p dir="auto" data-sourcepos="14:1-14:164">The only drawback here is that neither option allows for the "A11Y" text to be linkable to <a rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" href="https://a11yproject.com/posts/a11y-and-other-numeronyms/" target="_blank">Scott's post</a>.</p>
<p dir="auto" data-sourcepos="16:1-16:132"><a data-link="true" data-canonical-src="/uploads/eb9bc0f6d085c933648304d2ac5a52bb/58824457-bddd5880-8601-11e9-9834-05c0dfb131f2.jpg" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="http://ec2-13-59-140-179.us-east-2.compute.amazonaws.com:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/uploads/eb9bc0f6d085c933648304d2ac5a52bb/58824457-bddd5880-8601-11e9-9834-05c0dfb131f2.jpg" class="no-attachment-icon gfm" target="_blank"><img data-canonical-src="/uploads/eb9bc0f6d085c933648304d2ac5a52bb/58824457-bddd5880-8601-11e9-9834-05c0dfb131f2.jpg" class="gfm js-lazy-loaded" decoding="async" alt="a117y-not-an-abbr-but-this-is-simple" src="http://ec2-13-59-140-179.us-east-2.compute.amazonaws.com:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/uploads/eb9bc0f6d085c933648304d2ac5a52bb/58824457-bddd5880-8601-11e9-9834-05c0dfb131f2.jpg" loading="lazy" data-qa_selector="js_lazy_loaded_content"></a></p></div> <!----> <textarea data-update-url="/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/notes/305166" dir="auto" class="hidden js-task-list-field"></textarea> <!----> <!----> <!----></div> <div class="timeline-discussion-body-footer"></div></div></div></div></li><li class="timeline-entry note note-wrapper note-comment note-row-305167 is-editable" id="note_305167" data-award-url="/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/notes/305167/toggle_award_emoji" data-note-id="305167" data-qa-selector="noteable_note_container"><div class="timeline-entry-inner"><!----> <div class="timeline-avatar gl-float-left"><a href="/byteblaze" class="gl-link gl-avatar-link"><img src="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon" alt="Byte Blaze" class="gl-avatar gl-avatar-circle gl-avatar-s32"> </a></div> <div class="timeline-content"><div class="note-header"><div class="note-header-info"><!----> <a href="/byteblaze" data-user-id="2330" data-username="byteblaze" class="author-name-link js-user-link"><span class="note-header-author-name gl-font-weight-bold">

<script>
//<![CDATA[
if ('loading' in HTMLImageElement.prototype) {
  document.querySelectorAll('img.lazy').forEach(img => {
    img.loading = 'lazy';
    let imgUrl = img.dataset.src;
    // Only adding width + height for avatars for now
    if (imgUrl.indexOf('/avatar/') > -1 && imgUrl.indexOf('?') === -1) {
      const targetWidth = img.getAttribute('width') || img.width;
      imgUrl += `?width=${targetWidth}`;
    }
    img.src = imgUrl;
    img.removeAttribute('data-src');
    img.classList.remove('lazy');
    img.classList.add('js-lazy-loaded');
    img.dataset.qa_selector = 'js_lazy_loaded_content';
  });
}

//]]>
</script>
